name: Kay Ivey
funFact: First woman to serve a full term as Alabama governor, having originally been Lt. Governor.

name: Mike Dunleavy
funFact: At 6'7", one of the tallest governors in U.S. history. Former school principal and state senator.

name: Katie Hobbs
funFact: Former social worker and Arizona Secretary of State who was overseeing the 2022 election she was on the ballot in.

name: Sarah Huckabee Sanders
funFact: Daughter of former Arkansas Governor Mike Huckabee. Served as White House Press Secretary under President Trump.

name: Gavin Newsom
funFact: Former mayor of San Francisco who made national news in 2004 by ordering the city to issue same-sex marriage licenses.

name: Jared Polis
funFact: Internet entrepreneur worth hundreds of millions. First openly gay man elected governor in U.S. history.

name: Ned Lamont
funFact: Cable TV mogul who ran against Joe Lieberman in 2006. Great-grandnephew of banker Thomas W. Lamont.

name: Matt Meyer
funFact: Former New Castle County Executive and public school educator.

name: Ron DeSantis
funFact: Navy veteran and Harvard Law graduate. Launched a major national profile with aggressive COVID-19 policy battles.

name: Brian Kemp
funFact: Former Georgia Secretary of State who defied pressure to overturn the 2020 election results.

name: Josh Green
funFact: Emergency room physician who was still practicing medicine on the Big Island when he became governor.

name: Brad Little
funFact: Fourth-generation Idaho rancher. His family has farmed in southwestern Idaho for over 100 years.

name: JB Pritzker
funFact: Billionaire heir to the Hyatt hotel fortune who removed toilets from a mansion to lower its property tax assessment.

name: Mike Braun
funFact: Self-made businessman who built a national auto parts distribution company before entering politics.

name: Kim Reynolds
funFact: First woman elected governor of Iowa. Worked as a county treasurer before rising through state politics.

name: Laura Kelly
funFact: Former Kansas state senator who won in a heavily Republican state by focusing on education funding.

name: Andy Beshear
funFact: Son of former Kentucky Governor Steve Beshear. Won re-election in a heavily Republican state in 2023.

name: Jeff Landry
funFact: Former Louisiana Attorney General who signed a law requiring Ten Commandments displays in public schools.

name: Janet Mills
funFact: First woman elected governor of Maine. Former Maine Attorney General for seven years.

name: Wes Moore
funFact: Army veteran and Rhodes Scholar whose memoir 'The Other Wes Moore' became a New York Times bestseller.

name: Maura Healey
funFact: First openly lesbian governor elected in U.S. history. Former Division I basketball player at UNC.

name: Gretchen Whitmer
funFact: Survived a 2020 kidnapping plot foiled by the FBI. Nicknamed 'Big Gretch' by supporters.

name: Tim Walz
funFact: Former high school football coach and teacher. Ran for VP alongside Kamala Harris in 2024.

name: Tate Reeves
funFact: Former Mississippi Treasurer and Lt. Governor. Phi Beta Kappa graduate of Millsaps College.

name: Mike Kehoe
funFact: Former Missouri Lt. Governor and car dealership owner elected governor in 2024.

name: Greg Gianforte
funFact: Tech entrepreneur who founded RightNow Technologies. Made news in 2017 for body-slamming a reporter.

name: Jim Pillen
funFact: Former University of Nebraska football player and large-scale hog farmer.

name: Joe Lombardo
funFact: Former Clark County Sheriff who commanded the police response during the 2017 Las Vegas mass shooting.

name: Kelly Ayotte
funFact: Former U.S. Senator and New Hampshire Attorney General who won the governorship in 2024.

name: Phil Murphy
funFact: Former Goldman Sachs executive and U.S. Ambassador to Germany.

name: Michelle Lujan Grisham
funFact: Former U.S. Representative who became the first Democratic Latina governor in U.S. history.

name: Kathy Hochul
funFact: First woman to serve as New York governor, having ascended from Lt. Governor when Andrew Cuomo resigned.

name: Josh Stein
funFact: Former North Carolina Attorney General who won the 2024 gubernatorial race.

name: Kelly Armstrong
funFact: Former U.S. Representative and attorney who won the 2024 North Dakota gubernatorial race.

name: Mike DeWine
funFact: Former Ohio senator and attorney general. His response to the 2019 Dayton shooting drew rare bipartisan praise.

name: Kevin Stitt
funFact: Cherokee Nation citizen and mortgage company founder elected as the first Native American governor.

name: Tina Kotek
funFact: First openly lesbian governor elected in Oregon. Former Speaker of the Oregon House for a decade.

name: Josh Shapiro
funFact: Former Pennsylvania AG who investigated priest sex abuse. Considered a top Democratic national figure.

name: Dan McKee
funFact: Former Cumberland Town Council member and Lt. Governor who became governor when Raimondo joined Biden's cabinet.

name: Henry McMaster
funFact: First South Carolina official to endorse Donald Trump for president in 2016. Former state AG.

name: Larry Rhoden
funFact: Former South Dakota Lt. Governor and cattle rancher who became governor when Noem joined the cabinet.

name: Bill Lee
funFact: Businessman and farmer who gave away a quarter of his company's stock to employees when he sold it.

name: Greg Abbott
funFact: Has used a wheelchair since 1984 when a tree fell on him while jogging. Sued the tree's owner and won.

name: Spencer Cox
funFact: Former Fairview mayor and Lt. Governor known for his calls for civility and political cooperation.

name: Phil Scott
funFact: NASCAR race car driver and building contractor considered one of America's most moderate Republican governors.

name: Glenn Youngkin
funFact: Former co-CEO of The Carlyle Group, a private equity giant. Banned from running for re-election by Virginia law.

name: Bob Ferguson
funFact: Former Washington Attorney General who filed more lawsuits against the Trump administration than any other AG.

name: Patrick Morrisey
funFact: Former West Virginia Attorney General who spent years as a pharmaceutical lobbyist before politics.

name: Tony Evers
funFact: Former Wisconsin Superintendent of Public Instruction who won re-election in 2022 against a Trump-backed opponent.

name: Mark Gordon
funFact: Rancher and businessman who owns a fourth-generation family ranch near Buffalo, Wyoming.
